Segmenter Class Reference

#include <Segmenter.hpp>

Collaboration diagram for Segmenter:

Detailed Description

Segmenter of the OCR process.

This class encapsulates all the methods related to segmentation stage. Its task is to isolate every shape within a clip that represents a character, storing them in a data structure for further classification.

See also:
Clip, Shape, Pixel
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-13

Member Function Documentation

void Segmenter::applyThreshold ( Clip &  clip,
const unsigned char &  threshold,
const unsigned char &  backgroundReference 
)

Applies the threshold algorithm.

Parameters:
clip Press clip
threshold Threshold value to differentiate between back- and foreground pixels
backgroundReference Background reference gray level
Postcondition:
Every pixel has either a gray level of 0 or 255.

The inkValue_ member is initialized to the gray level that represents the ink's gray level

See also:
Clip
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-13
Simple thresholding that compares each pixel's gray level with a threshold value. The background reference gray level is taken into account to decide the final gray level that must be applied to the pixel.

Definition at line 27 of file Segmenter.cpp.

Referenced by Recognizer::obtainText().

void Segmenter::applyFloodFill ( const Clip &  clip  ) 

Applies the flood fill algorithm.

Precondition:
The clip MUST be thresholded by calling applyThreshold() method before.
Postcondition:
The seeds_ member is initialized to a vector of pixels that generates each shape found.

The shapes_ member is initialized to a vector of shapes that represents character within the clip.

Parameters:
clip Press clip
See also:
Clip
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-13
The 'flood fill' algorithm is a segmentation technique that isolates every shape in a clip that represents a character. Every shape is built starting from a seed, i.e. an ink pixel, exploring recursively its neighbourhood and adding every ink pixel that is connected to the seed. The process ends when there are not more ink pixels connected and the shape is completely isolated.

2. For each seed explore its neighbourhood

3. Sort shapes according to their position within the clip

void Segmenter::findSeeds ( const Clip &  clip  )  [private]

Finds all the ink pixels within a clip that may grow up as a shape.

Postcondition:
The seeds_ member is initialized
Parameters:
clip The press clip
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-17
All the pixels of the clip are explored, adding to the vector of seeds_ those whose gray level is equal to the ink's gray level stablished in the call to applyThreshold() method.
